Reviews.Title: “On canal in old Venice”
Reviews.Author: Richard W
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Riva in a third floor room with a view of one of the main gondola canals.We could lie in our bed and listen to the gondoliers singing and playing. Great atmosphere.Our room was small but cozy and clean. No elevator so you will need to lug your bags. The bathroom had a full shower and was adequately sized. The hotel staff was welcoming but spoke limited English. A simple breakfast was served in a pleasant room downstairs off of reception. The hotel is a few blocks behing St. Marks Square in the maze of old streets. The streets are confusing and you can spend a lot of time looking for the Riva. Therefore, print the map off the hotel website. Rick Steves' Italy book also has good directions based on land marks. Very near lots of shops and restaurants and not very far from the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: paigef19
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at this hotel. Our room was on the second floor and had a window that looked out onto the canal. I needed a hair dryer and they were more than happy to loan me one. The room was a good size and was comfortable. The hotel was super close to St. Mark's and really was in a great location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good as ever, but chaotic and undergoing refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: digitalplumber
Reviews.Content: Fourth time at the riva, always a nice place to stay; fab location and the lady who runs the place is lovely. Was undergoing a refurb when we were there so we stayed the first night at some apartment a few metres from the main hotel. Breakfast was in a nearby cafe which was ok, except for being mugged for â‚¬7 for an orange juice "that isn't included in the breakfast". Still, once it's refurbed and doing their own breakfasts again we'll be back for out fifth visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Venice”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyCathy
Reviews.Content: We took the water bus from the airport to St. Marks. It was easy to find the hotel using the map that we had printed out from their web site. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning and were instructed to leave our luggage right there in the lobby while we went out to see the city. And it was fine. We had to carry our bags up several floors as there is no elevator but we were rewarded with a corner room overlooking two canals. There were three large windows that opened to the most fabulous views. It is what you travel to Venice to experience. Gondolas, water taxis, singing, accordions playing. Just wonderful. It is close to St. Marks Square with lots of shops and restaurants. There was plenty of hot water in the rather small bathroom. You must go downstairs to use the internet. There is a small breakfast served in the morning that consists of American style coffee (that was a good thing for us) and bread with Nutella. Not a bad way to start the day. The room is charming with a Merano glass chandelier and breezes flowing in those wonderful windows but unfortunately the beds leave a lot to be desired. That would not keep me from staying here or recommending it to others, just letting you know.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action yet quiet; Charming rooms; Kindly staff”
Reviews.Author: JudithW W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed two times in Hotel Riva and enjoyed both visits very much. Very close to the boats and thus moving through crowds with luggage is a small task. The hotel is tucked away so do your homework in finding out where it is. It will surprise you how very close it is to Piazza San Marco and yet how quiet your room is. Yes, many of the rooms were small -in March 2009, I traveled with my brother and we had singles- but during my recent visit, May 2011, I was with husband and 2 other couples and so we had 3 doubles. Those rooms are a nice size.The staff is most accomodating and friendly. Okay, there is no lift and the breakfast is minimal however I have been in Venice seven times since 2001 but enjoyed my stay at Hotel Riva more than any other hotel. I am planning another trip for 2012 and hope to find open rooms for that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay in Hotel Riva”
Reviews.Author: BKB629
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Riva with two sisters. We went to the hotel from the train station by vaporetto and followed Rick Steves' directions, so it was easy to find. Just be sure you get the vaporetto in the direction toward St. Mark's. The hotel is quite close to St. Mark's Square. We are senior citizens, so the lovely marble stairs, even with our small suitcases, were a challenge. However, when we got to our room, it was worth it. The view out the window of the canals and the gondoliers made me feel like I truly was in Venice. The room was not large, but it was adequate. The furnishings were attractive and the room and bathroom were clean. I thought the Riva was a lovely, small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Jeff222
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riva is in a good location and the staff was courteous and friendly. The room we had was on the 4th floor and it was difficult carrying luggage up four flights of stairs (no elevator). It was also warm and humid when we visited so I was drenched after that exercise. The room was tiny. We shared a common bathroom with three other rooms. It is not air conditioned but they did provide a fan. The room overlooked one of the canals; this was fun but also added to the noise as power boats also use the canals. My wife and I like more comfort and something less rigourous. At 100 euro, however, it was a bargain for Venice. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: arcoccia
Reviews.Content: Great location close to St. Marks right on a canal.Our room was huge, but others in the group were average except for the shower door which was very small.There is no lift so get ready for stairs, and breakfast is nothing special,but for the price your paying, enjoy a role and a few cappuccinos and have a great dinner. Also staff is very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: EAH2327
Reviews.Content: This is a cute hotel very close to St. Marc's square. The location was perfect. The hotel staff and owners were wonderful. The rooms were very clean, with comfy beds. We had requested a/c but didn't get it. There was a fan in the room and the nights were cool enough for sleeping, so this didn't end up being a huge problem. "Breakfast" was water bread with butter and jam. Come to find out, all the bread in Venice is like this for some reason. Oh, well. On the upside, there was great coffee and lots of it! We would certainly stay here again. You can get up in the morning and have coffee while watching gondoliers row their way past you. Bliss!

Reviews.Title: “fine in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: jennielee1975
Reviews.Content: It's hard to say whether or not the hotel is good value, as everything in Venice is hyper-inflated. We did appreciate the location, which was great, and the owners were unbelievably nice and gracious. It smarts to pay so much to haul your own suitcase up several flights of narrow stairs and to eat nasty store-bought rolls with nutella for the 'Italian breakfast' every morning. If you start your trip here, it will only get better. If you end here, adjust your expectations. It's cool to have a canal view, but then you also get canal noise. How many times are you willing to hear 'Volare' being sung to tourists in a gondola?

Reviews.Title: “Captures the essence of Venezia”
Reviews.Author: UnsheepishlySeattle
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, in lovely canal-side location. It is a long ways from the train station, but an easy walk to/from Piazza San Marco so definitely take the vaporetto with your luggage. The room and bathroom were very very tiny, though I suspect everything is in Venice. The rates, while more than we paid throughout the rest of Italy, were the lowest I was able to find in Venice. "Breakfast: was the same dry dinner rolls every morning which gets pretty dull, but itâ€™s nice to at least be able to have a cup of coffee and grab a serving of nutella before you head out into the day. Love the first impression of walking into this homey but elegant lobby with gondaliers right outside the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Owners Sandro and Iris made our trip.”
Reviews.Author: joe036
Reviews.Content: After arriving at our booked hotel Locanda Ca Del Console and being told they overbooked and there was no room for us, (having paid for it 6 monhs earlier) I could envisage a disaster was about to develop. We were moved to Hotel RIVA under protest but I am so glad now that we were moved. The hotel RIVA is much closer to St Marcos Square and the room we had with canal views was excellent. If you want a 5 star hotel, don't come here. But if we want a family type hotel with a comfortable bed, decent shower and toilet at a good price then this is it. The water taxi stops right out the front and I recommend anyone going to Venice to grab a water taxi. The extra price is worth it. It will save you dragging you luggage over bridges all around Venice and arriving exhausted. The owners Sandro and Iris were so helpful. They welcomed us as if we were family and assured us that even though the other hotel left us without a room, they would would fix everything. And they did. They helped us even taking our luggage up and when we left, Sandro even helped us bringing our luggage down. Breakfast was acceptable with good coffee. The room has no tv or barfridge but it is not needed for a few days stay and this is what keeps their price down. Thank you Sandro, Iris and even the lovely lady at the desk I think her name was Daniela. You made our stay in Venice memorable and next time you are on top of our list. Giuseppe Colosi and Carmela

Reviews.Title: “Perfect atmosphere for a stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: MontclairLinda
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to be right on a canal and have the gondolas passing under our window. Being close to St. Mark's Square made it a convenient location. For a small hotel we were surprised to have WiFi available. The bed was comfortable and we slept fine with the fan that was in the room.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: JeanClaudeandSophi
Reviews.Content: This place had character. We found it in the Rick Steves guidebook. Our room was tiny, but who cares? You're in Venice! Who's hanging in their room? LOL We loved Venice. Our room was comfortable and on the canal, and we shared a bathroom with 3 other rooms, but they have rooms with no view and private bath. The rooms that share bathrooms have their own sinks in their room though. Their breakfast and coffee was bad. I think they are trying to make "American" coffee to please the Americans, but it's terrible. We would stay here again. Can't wait to go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly Owner!”
Reviews.Author: Shubin777
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice for the first time and took the crowded vaparetto from the train station to San Marco. We arrived mid day so walking through the crowded San Marco square all luggage in hand was challenging. I would suggest arriving by 9 if possible to make traveling through the square easier. We used the map from the hotelâ€™s website and it was so helpful. We were expecting to get lost at least once on the way to the hotel and couldnâ€™t believe we found it so quickly. Literally 2 minutes walking distance from San Marco square. When we arrived the young woman at the front desk was so friendly and spoke great English. She was welcoming and had our passports ready in fifteen minutes. We had room was #7 it was up a few flights of marble stairs but we read that on other posts so it was no problem. The room was small and nothing fancy we did pay for a corner room with a view and had a great view although we were one room over from the actual corner. The breakfast was literally a dinner roll and packaged nutella and jam but the coffee that was made by the ownerâ€™s wife was delicious...seriously best I've ever had. She wasn't very friendly but her husband more than made up for it. We would stay at this hotel again because of him alone. We had a few conversations (he didn't speak English and we donâ€™t speak Italian) so there were language barriers for sure but he was so genuine. When I would figure out what he was saying or visa versa he would get so excited. We asked for a good place to eat and he offered to walk us there himself and we saw him out and about one night and he recognized us and said hello my friends...at least I think thatâ€™s what he was saying. â˜º

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very cute hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cmesau
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riva is a great place to stay in Venice. It is right on the canal, and our canal-view room was very picturesque. The hotel interior had beautiful marble staircases and felt very Italian. The breakfast was ok, just coffee/tea and a roll, and we had difficulty communicating with the owners when we checked in, but overall it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kdf63
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riva is located on a canal just 2 minutes walk from the hustle of St Mark's Square and a short walk to the Rialto. Our family had two double rooms and one triple. Rooms were clean and comfortable with typical small, but functional bathrooms. The owners and staff were friendly and helpful. The location and value made this a winner for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location.”
Reviews.Author: laurienneq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Riva on our 10 day tour of Italy. It wasn't our favorite hotel on the trip, but it wasn't terrible. Venice is charming and the hotel is pretty charming too. Our room was TINY (especially the bathroom), but we had a canal view, a comfortable bed, and cute antique furnishings. And it's soooo quiet! The breakfast was included in the room price and consisted of bread, jam, coffee and juice and there was free Wi-Fi in the lobby. The location is GREAT! Pretty easy to find (as easy as anything is to find in the maze that is Venice) and halfway between San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. The Rialto vaporetti stop is a much quicker way to get to and from the train station, but more difficult to find the hotel... so I'd recommend starting from San Marco the first time because from there it's a simple walk with two turns and one bridge crossing. Also, there is a Gondola parked right outside the hotel, which is much nicer and more relaxing than taking a Gondola ride right next to 20 other tourists on Gondolas near the Hard Rock or Grand Canal. Venice is expensive and many reasonably priced options are booked months in advance, so if you find Hotel Riva as one of your available choices, I would recommend grabbing a room while you can.

Reviews.Title: “Negligent, with callous disregard for their hotel guests”
Reviews.Author: glogig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Riva at the beginning of our two-week trip to Italy. The second day into the trip I returned from an afternoon of sightseeing. My room was on the second floor at the end of a very hall. The stairway leading up to the second floor was pitch black, and the lights did not go on when motion was detected. I attempted to locate the light switch at the top of the stairs, but in doing so I fell down four of the marble stairs and landed in the doorway of another guest's room. The owner, a purported medical doctor, and two employees came running. I told the owner that I had broken my wrist as it was positioned at an odd angle. He asked if I could move my fingers, and when I said I could, he proceeded to take my wrist and shake it and tell me that it was not broken. He was in a hurry to get me to stand up and go to my room and get out of the hallway. I told him that I was not ready to get up as I was quite shaken by the experience. Someone brought me some ice, and that was the last I saw or heard from anyone. He didn't offer any type of medical assistance. When we left the next day, the owner didn't even inquire as to how I was feeling. You could tell he just wanted to get rid of us. This was quite distressing as I was in a lot of pain and, as it turns out, I had to cut my trip short and return home as my wrist was broken in four places and required surgery which I am still recovering from. This negligence and callous disregard for their guests is something people should keep in mind when considering a stay at the Hotel Riva. I am sure I am not the first, nor the last person to have a serious accident due to their refusal to install light sensors. Further, this was a Rick Steves pick which I am hoping he will reconsider publishing when I send him this review.

Reviews.Title: “One star hotel and enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: Mrralst
Reviews.Content: It's Venice- everything is at a premium. If you want an unfussy central base close to the shops, st marks square, public transport then this '1 star' hotel offers that. Remember it is '1 star' so you get what you pay for. No frills, friendly service at an uninspiring breakfast. That's it. But it is tucked away and you can blend in with little pretension and go and enjoy Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, but not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Colee626
Reviews.Content: We stayed here beacuse it was a reasonable price, near St Mark's Square, and recommended by Rick Steve's. The hotel itself was fine, even though I think it was extremely overpriced, but Venice is expensive. We had NO hot water, had to take cold showers, and management didn't warn us about it at checkin. Don't expect much for breakfast: we got a pot of coffee and 2 plain bread rolls we could put nutella or jam on. The gentleman (who we think is the owner) was extremely nice, but we could never be encouraged to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie4742
Reviews.Content: Although the Hotel Riva was pretty easy to find, I wish we had missed it! The older woman at the desk was very rude...no greeting, just asked for our passports, gave us a key and said to come back later to pick them up. We had room 32, at the very top and back, and no handrails going up the stairs. The room was very dark with very poor lighting and the window opened to an air duct shaft shared with 3 other buildings with their windows facing our window. The walls were also very thin and two of our walls were shared with residents of an apartment building that partied for 3 days straight. There was no ventilation at all and no air conditioning. I asked Sandro 3 times for a fan, he would just smile and say tomorrow, tomorrow never came. The sheets and towels were stained and every time they changed the linen they were always stained. The hallways were very dark during the day, but at night you couldn't see anything because there are no lights, luckily my husband had brought a small flashlight. Breakfast was a joke, 2 stale hard rolls apiece, 4 oz. juice, and instant or worse coffee. The only nice thing was a young lady was at the desk the first afternoon when I requested a hair dryer, she smiled graciously and got one for me. The Hotel Riva was the worst hotel we've ever stayed in and we travel quite a bit. It is old, outdated, and the toilet seat was cracked and every time they cleaned the room they insisted on hanging the TP on the very top rung of the towel rack, a good 6 feet off the floor! Oh, one last thing, we asked Sandro if we could use his computer to print out our boarding passes...he just grinned, said NO, and sent us away. Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “DUSTY, OVER PRICED despite Rick Steve's opinion”
Reviews.Author: katcosmic
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the location because it was 5 minutes from San Marco and 10 minutes from Rialto, however......The rooms are the size of a postage stamp! The bathrooms even smaller! If you're larger than a size 10 forget using the shower. Bring your own towels because you will be using a waffle type kitchen towel and NO wash clothes, or shampoo. It's the bare minimum at this "hotel?" Also, I know some people said it was clean, our bathroom was dirty with hair on the floor and on the shower florr too, plus dirt in the corners on the floors. The staff was nice..........the breakfast was HARD rolls, nutella, jelly, juice, coffee or hot cocoa all served on linen table clothes and in a beautiful room! DUST everywhere...and magazines strewn all over the place. Sorry not thrilled with this place, not for the money spent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, rooms disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MissAtalanta
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Riva is literally a rocks throw into the heart of San Marco. If you want to stay close the the piazza then for the price this is probably the best option. However, noticing all the cruise ships coming into port; to get the real Venice Charm I might suggest staying away from San Marco as it is VERY crowded in the afternoon. Almost unpleasant there are so many people. The location of Riva was nice, right on a gondola canal but the rooms were not much to speak of. We had a double room overlooking the canal and the view was pretty much all it had going for it. I'm only 5'6 and I felt like I barely could use the bathroom; if someone is much taller than that...good luck! The towels were horrible too; it felt like we were drying off with sandpaper...no joke. I know that staying in Venice is expensive but it might be worth staying a bit further from San Marco to get more for your money. The view was great; but most of the time is spent enjoying Venice so not sure I would pay for it again. Also, don't count on the "breakfast included" it is merely a piece of bread and some coffee. Scones and Caffe elsewhere are a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Minuses outweighed the plusses.”
Reviews.Author: lindahagenmiller
Reviews.Content: Good location near San Marco Square and right on a canal. Owner Sandro was welcoming, accommodating and helpful. However, potential guests should know that rooms are very small and bathrooms are the size of an American refrigerator. My 6'4" husband could literally not squeeze into the shower or sit on the toilet (knees against the facing wall). Bed was not comfortable, there was no place to put clothes but a tiny wardrobe and no room on the floor to put suitcases that were forced to serve as dressers. Canal location is charming till 5 AM when the delivery boats start chugging past, gunning their motors. Saw many older guests struggling up and down the stairs with their luggage(no lift). The breakfast is minimal. At 140 Euro (about 210 USD) a night, it was not even a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and charming, perfect location, beautiful canal view from corner rooms, but expect minimal breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kheerni
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in Rick Steve's book. On Rick's suggestion we booked a corner room as these have the best view of the canal. We are very glad we did that as the view out of our windows was very pretty and really made us feel we were in Venice. Bear in mind that the corner rooms have no air conditioning, but if you are there after late August and before summer then you should be fine. In early September we had crisp cool breezes and needed a light cover up during the days so no A/C was not a problem at all. What the hotel lacks in size it more than makes up for in charm. Our room was tiny and the bathroom even tinier (although I know from a friend that not all rooms are the same size) but it was very charming and we were pleased with it. Plus the minute you open up the windows and see the gondolas glide lazily by you are in love. This hotel is a walk-up. So when I called to ask for corner room availability I was told I had an option for which floor I wanted it on - First, second, third or fourth. Since we had a small child with us we opted for the first floor corner room. Soon after our trip, my colleague stayed at the hotel and she had a fourth floor corner room. We exchanged notes and found that her corner room on the fourth floor was very large and was the one that Rick had stayed in! It is true that the breakfast here is very skimpy. We only had bread, butter, jam, nutella, orange juice, milk and coffee as options. However, this did not matter to us as we needed the bare minimum to start the day and would pick up other goodies once outside. We had friends who were staying at a very expensive chain hotel who complained they had no breakfast included and were charged for even bottled water! So, in comparison I have no complaints. It was a tad annoying that on a couple of nights when we returned late (I think it was around 11 or 11:30) the door to the little hotel was locked and we had to ring a bell and wait for the sleepy night manager to open the door to us. But on the plus side, the small size of the hotel meant that when we needed cold milk for our daughter at night when we returned my husband just had to ask the night manager for it or he just made his way to the fridge in the dining area and poured it out himself - and again, the hotel did not charge us for this. All in all, I would definitely recommend Hotel Riva.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms leave much to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: UFPA10
Reviews.Content: Near San Marco is the place to stay, and for the price this is probably the place to do it. The location was nice, right on a gondola canal but the rooms were not much to speak of. Which essentially is fine because Venice is stunning and we used it only as a place to crash, refresh and recharge. Check out Lido beach if you get time. Doges palace was better than expected as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfotable quiet rooms friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nurseanne
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this small hotel with a great canal view from our room. The room was large with a nice private bathroom. We were near the top floor so as expected there were several short flights of stairs to climb. Staff were friendly and even accomodated our request for ice for an afternoon drink in our room. We loved hearing the Gondoliers singing in the early evening. Very romantic. Location was excellent with San Marco square just steps away Breakfast was small, just a roll, jams and tea or coffee and a juice but sufficient to start the day.We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: MiishaMeemers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riva was very easy to find from San Marco square and the location was perfect for our first visit to Italy. We did our research on this hotel before we left and must admit we were not at all disappointed. We were given a room on the top floor with a shared bathroom. The room had incredible canal views (in fact, it looked out to where 2 canals met) with gondoliers singing throughout the day/night. The room was small, but adequate - if you're looking for 5 star accommodations, this is not the place BUT if you're planning on actually visiting and exploring Venice, this is an excellent place to crash for the night. There are a lot of stairs to the top floor but it is worth it for the view. The breakfast was simple, but adequate - buns with jam/nutella, caffe latte's and a canal view in typical Italian decor - quite delightful actually. Those who have left reviews obviously don't appreciate simplicity or Italian culture because this hotel is exactly the type of place we were looking for. In addition, I accidently left my Canon SLR battery plugged in when we checked out and the hotel kindly had it couriered to Canada. If that's not going above & beyond I'm not sure what is. We will definitely stay should we ever venture back to Venice again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed- not worth the requested price”
Reviews.Author: Nikol13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a previous customer and after checking its webiste photos we booked a double room with private bathroom, with canal view for 130euro out of a range price online between 90-140euro, depending on the room you get. We did not get our worth of money for sure. Instead of the high-end paid room, we got probalby the worse room they had. I can't think they are worse rooms than this let to people. It was no.22, up on the top floor, with a tiny window, no view -but they claimed it is canal view. There was a bed, a sideboard with a lamp, a tiny wardrobe that didn't fit a hanger, none of which had 18th century character as they claim online, but were sure not cleaned since then. Very depressing to be in there. Spider nets, dust, splils on the walls, sticky lightswitches, the bedlinen weren't ironed and had couple tiny holes, the blanket was old and extremely used, and in the tiny bathroom we were given only two tiny soaps and two terrible towel-like pieces of cloth. They did not renew anything over a 2-night stay. No such things like, telephone, TV, showergel, shampoo, hairdryer, iron,an armchair or any other chair to put your sutff on.. nothing. The next morning we found out that for 50 euro more we could have stayed in a 4 star boutique hotel in the same area. It did not worth the money, but it is a great location, as so many other hotels in the area, and we had a fantastic time otherwise. Anywhere in Venice is a great location really. And although you do not need any hotel amenities at Rive Hotel, you should not pay for them either when you don't get them. So bring your own toiletries, towels and bedsheets if you insist on booking there and do arrive early so that you can bargain the room you get. We complained but they said they had no other room to give us, so we still paid more than the minimum online range, 110euro, after insisting that they deduct the canal-view money) but the service overall was very poor. And you had to be back by 1pm.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: kbel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. The room was very clean and very cute. The lobby of the hotel was very pretty. We paid 120 Euros per night for a double room with bathroom. I did not reserve a canal view room for 20 Euros extra, but if you put your head out the window you could see the canal, which was enough for me. The breakfast wasn't much, just bread and nutella or jelly and coffee, tea or chocolate, but adequate. From my research this is a very reasonably priced hotel. I greatly enjoyed it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel very close to St Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: StampsNart
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is on a small canal a five minute walk from St Mark's. We had no trouble with our luggage from the train station, on the public vaporetto and then the short walk. The hard part was that the hotel has no elevator but other guests assisted us seniors. This hotel is a Rick Steves pick for inexpensive hotels. When we left, we splurged with a water taxi that picked us up at the door. 4 of us and luggage cost 70 euro to the bus station. The cold breakfast was adequate with great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you want. . . . .”
Reviews.Author: savannahtraveler59
Reviews.Content: If you want a lavish breakfast or a hotel without stairs,then Hotel Riva is not for you, But if you can overlook these drawbacks and enjoy hearing the gondoliers sing,you will have a wonderful stay.My husband and I are particularly grateful to the owner and his wife for the kindness that they showed during our recent stay.We had some distressing news from home and they were more than gracious and comforting during our time of need.We will always remember their kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but doable if nothing else available . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: Kipper2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs a good cleaning. Woman at the front desk (we think it's the owner's wife), is rude, the husband was very sweet. Breakfast is a joke: it's a dinner roll with some Nutella and a lukewarm cup of cappucino. Dumb! Bed was ok, clean sheets at least. Probably wouldnt stay again, but could do it, if i we had to. Not the worst we have stayed in, but not good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and canal view but”
Reviews.Author: michaelhuskey
Reviews.Content: If a person follows Rick Steves' directions, the hotel is easy to find, and the location just a few blocks off Saint Mark's Square is hard to beat. My wife and I paid for a canal view room, and the view was lovely. The room is of adequate size by European standards, and the owners are quite accomodating. On the other hand, anyone put off by stairs would do well to look elsewhere, and the unchanging breakfast is probably the least satisfactory of any I have experienced in a decade of European travel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and view”
Reviews.Author: JPHughes
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel with a great canal veiw out your window and in an excellent location, I recommend you stay here. The place had all we needed. The host was extremely polite, helpful, and cheerful. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lisatdav3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights (Wed & Thurs) in June. We had a hard time finding the place, but once we arrived we were greeted by the owner and upgraded- no extra charge- to a room overlooking the canal. We were on our own for carrying our luggage up 3 flights of stairs with no elevator available, but as we'd been lugging it around all day anyway it wasn't too much of a hassle. Our room was very nice- Room #28 (I believe) and had exposed wood beams, beautiful antique furniture, and a great view of the canal and the campanile bell tower. Only a short walk to St. Marks square. The breakfast is minimal with only coffee and rolls, but the breakfast room is quite beautiful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: jaimepona
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were traveling to Venice from La Spezia via train and the trip took longer than anticipated. I called the hotel and was greeted with a lot of attitude when I told them we would be arriving quite late. When we arrived, the gentleman working greeted us at the door begrudgingly, then handed the two of us a key to room 18. He then notified us that there was a 1am curfew then the front door would be locked from inside and out, and we would have to buzz the owner to get in or out after that time. he then went to bed, not offering to help us with our 6 pieces of lugguge, nor mentioning that room 18 was 4 stories up stairs in a building with no elevator. Once we reached our room we discovered that it was one of 2 rooms in the entire hotel with no air conditioning, despite there being 12 open rooms available when we checked in. During the night, we slept with the windows open ,on sandpaper sheets being eaten alive by mosquitos. Breakfast the next morning consisted of a basket of dinner rolls with jams and jellies. No fruit, not options. All in all, a terrible experience. That afternoon, we found an adjacent hotel for slightly more money and amenities 1000X better. Not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice decor on a romantic canal - needs a better breakfast”
Reviews.Author: baronejenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon vacation. I have stayed at a few mid-range hotels over the years in Venice, and typically the rooms and bathrooms can be very small, but the Hotel Riva was one of the nicest ones so far. They also have wood beam ceilings, great period furniture which makes it feel very cozy, and most rooms face the busy canal with gondolas floating by every few moments past the bridge of sighs. I have to agree with the breakfast being really pretty poor. I actually opted to forgo the free breakfast one morning and get a coffee and cornetto at a local cafe. It was much better, even though I had to pay for it. They need fresh pastries, fresh nutella and also better coffee to improve their breakfast. But, they do have a very beautiful breakfast room right on the canal. Nice views! As for the curfew mentioned, I did not experience it as Venice does not have much of a nightlife at all! For the price, the location and the decor, I think Hotel Riva offers a great value for Venice and I would recommend it. It is absolutely steps away from the San Marco and a short walk to the Rialto bridge. My one warning is to watch out for the restaurants around there as they tend to rip off tourists. See if you can find some locals (hard to find in Venice!) and ask for a recommendation or search on this website for a good restaurant. Beware as we were ripped off quite a bit with bad touristy food and mean waiters.

Reviews.Title: “Most horrible hotel ever & it has a curfew of 1a!!”
Reviews.Author: Anayansi_P
Reviews.Content: Don't even know where to start... This hotel was horrible! My friend & got lost on the train and didn't make it to Venice till close to 1a. We called to let them know we were running late & they said they would wait for us. When we got there (exhausted & stressed out), our host was extremely rude and mean to us and didn't even help us (both women) with our 3 large suitcases up the 5 flight of stairs! Didn't even offer to help!! The rooms were dark, depressing and just overall uncomfortable. The bed sheets felt like cardboard and the room was filled with mosquitos which kept attacking me all night. Also, the place has a curfew of 1a... yes, a curfew!! Which they do not list on their site. If you come after 1a you have to ring the bell and the cranky and rude host comes and opens the door for you!! We were suppose to have stayed at this place for 2 nights but checked out after the 1st night and moved to the very nice and hospitable Hotel Colombina across the canal! They still charged us for the 2nd night. At that point we didn't care, we just wanted out of this hell hole! Oh, and the breakfast was crappy... a piece of break and coffee. Absolutely the worst service, rooms and place ever!! DON'T STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location...be prepared to climb some stairs”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat...some rooms overlook beautiful canals (canal rooms are considerably smaller than ones that don't have canal views). It is a 1 minute walk, if that, to the amazing Saint Mark's Square and a 5-7 minute walk to Rialto Bridge. Staff is very friendly, but as mentioned in header, be expected to climb some stairs. The breakfast if pretty much non-existent and should be improved considerably. My wife and I passed it up after the first day and spent the following 3 days eating elsewhere. Other than that, the place is a decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with great canal views”
Reviews.Author: Squez
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Riva was very pleasant. The staff was very friendly, although they spoke little English. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a room with a canal view at no extra cost. The rooms were clean and comfortable, not overly big, but we didn't spent much time in our room. Location was very near St. Marks Square, but a little difficult to find without a good map. Overall, we would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is great!”
Reviews.Author: Sierra009
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days in this very nice hotel which is well-located very near St. Markâ€™s Square; locating it required asking directions several times from the vaporetto stop and of course added to the adventure. The couple who run it are very nice, quite accommodating and huge Rick Stevesâ€™ fans showing us their picture of him taken when he stayed at the hotel just 3 weeks previous! The rooms are pleasant, quiet and clean with comfortable beds. Continental breakfast included. The value is good â€“ they give a Rick Steves discount!! This hotel rates excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: NOnionsXPickles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my boyfriend and his parents, and it was my favorite hotel during our trip through Italy! It's a great location, right in the heart of Venice, behind St Marks Square, next to a little canal. Based on that alone, I would expect prices to be much higher. It's a cute building with marble flooring throughout. Our room with a shared bath was on the top floor - warning: no elevators - with a canal view. There was only one other room on that floor, and it felt very private and peaceful. There is a bathroom on the top floor, too, so only those two rooms would be using it. The bf's parents had a room with private bath on the bottom floor, which was nice and roomy. The folks at reception were quite nice, though recommended a horrible restaurant for dinner. The breakfast is pretty basic, but no complaints. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cindyloufromwa
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap hotel near St. Mark's. After looking at several that were very expensive or too dirty we tried the Hotel Riva. Price was medium (120 euros) but our room was very small - the bed took up the entire room with just a small walkway around all sides. Bathroom was in need of updating - shower was very tiny (you could barely turn around in it). Very basic and minimal - no soap, shampoo, hairdryer, etc... but the place seemed extremely clean and the location was perfect - just a block behind Piazza San Marco. Plenty of shops and great restaurants nearby. Besides we were only there for sleeping - the rest of the time we'd be seeing Venice. Female owner spoke a little English but did not seem very friendly. However her husband whom we met the next day was very friendly and nice. The free breakfast the next morning was minimal also - rolls and coffee, tea or hot cocoa (warning - the hot cocoa was not like our hot chocolate in the US - instead very bitter cocoa powder and hot water!). The breakfast room however was very pretty and charming. The hotel is located off a pretty canal and although we didn't get a canal-view room if we leaned out our window we could see the canal and gondolas. All in all it was a nice little hotel if you don't mind the size of the room. We heard our neighbors (walls are very thin) exclaim how beautiful and large their room was so I guess some rooms are better than others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet Location”
Reviews.Author: Aimen
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Venice on 9/19/09 and stayed at The Riva hotel. Its a 2 star hotel with a 2 star hotel ammenities. The room is basic a double bed with side tables and an armoir and a chair is basically all there is furniture wise. No TV no hair dryer. A little dark some extra lighteing could help with only two electrical outlets. There are a few rooms that face the canal but our 20 euros more expensive then the one we got. We didnt spend much time in the room anyways so though it was a waste to spend 20 extra euros. The room was small maybe 10 by 10 feet. with an old rustic feel. How small it was shocked is initially but it grew on us. The best part about it was It was really clean and since me and my husband both are freaks when it comes to cleanliness it passed even out inspection which is rare. Bathrooms were mordern and super clean and a big enough shower from european standards. The hosts were very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the breakfast which was cold continental. Crissonts and coffee basically. Probably the least number of choices of all the hotels we stayed at but this was the only 2 star one of those so perhaps that had something to do with it. Location is excellent on the St Marks Square on the left of St Marks if you are facing it is a clock tower underneath which is the street that take you to it. The kepts our bags when we checked out since our train to Florence wasnt till later which was nice of them. SUMMERY: All in all clean and comfortable for a 2 star hotel with a location which is the best feature and for 120 euros a night probably cant find a better deal that close to the square. Excellent for budget travellers who want to stay close to the action and dont want too mant frills and just a bed to sleep in at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but with drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: travellingtiger49
Reviews.Content: The husband and wife owners were lovely and very helpful, their hotel was impressive for its one-star rating with nicely finished marble detail and chandeliers and the happy smiling people in the breakfast room seemed to be having a really great time. However, I have to share my experience. I booked a room knowing there would be a four-flight climb and a shared bathroom because I wanted to have a room with a view of the canal. Technically, I got that but it was a small window in the corner of the room which I had to lean out to see the canal. And there were no singing gondoliers to be heard! So, I got what I ordered but was pretty disappointed with the result and I suspect others might be as well. Maybe corner rooms on lower would have been better. Also, my husband and I each slept in grooves at the very edges of the bed -- obviously this mattress had seen a few too many bodies. Finally, the showers in the shared bathrooms had entry doors that were very narrow. Sliding glass door panels created a space that even my husband, who wears a size medium, found to be tight. I am a fairly large girl and didn't have a hope of squeezing in. Many smaller than me, I think, would also have had a challenge with these doors. Not so fun. Despite these challenges, I would stay at Hotel Riva again, foregoing the need to have a canal-side room and confirming in advance that I would have a more satisfactory shower.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SJCR44
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riva has an excellent location (especially for the price) just a few streets over from St Mark's square! (the tripadvisor map doesn't show it in the right location) You may want to keep in mind that it is several bridges from the vaparetto stops, especially if you're carrying many large bags. The quad room was very basic, but clean and spacious, with 1 double bed and 2 singles. It also had a small bathroom which was a little dated. When you open the shutters, you could lean out the window and see the canal and gondola stop (right at the hotel front door). The street was quiet at night, but became active in the morning. Breakfast was rolls, coffee or hot chocolate. I recommend the Nutella spread :)

Reviews.Title: “great find!”
Reviews.Author: slowclimb
Reviews.Content: We'd been warned that Venice was expensive, but had no idea that it would be that hard to find a budget hotel in a good location. Although at the price, it's hardly what I'd label as "budget," but after staying at the quaint Hotel Riva and experiencing it's beautiful spot, great location, and wonderful staff, I would definitely recommend it as a great value. The hotel is located close to San Marco Plaza, but just far enough away so that the noise from the square didn't disturb us. Breakfast is very sparse (just coffee, hot chocolate, juice and bread and jam), but I later found that this is pretty much the standard in Europe unless you are prepared to pay. The room was nice, although the walk up 4 flights of stairs to get to it was a little rough. Although looking back, all of those climbs were just getting us prepared for the Cinque Terre! I'd definitely recommend requesting a lower floor if stairs give you a problem. We had a room with a canal view, which was small, but still nice and did have a sink in the room. We only had to share a bathroom with 3 other rooms, which wasn't an issue at all. The canal view was nice, but not incredibly impressive since Venice is pretty much all canal views anyway. I think that I'd recommend taking a room on a lower level over paying extra for the canal view if you have a choice. We met the owner when we checked out - he was so nice! We'd definitely recommend both Venice and Hotel Riva!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: jcmuelle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Riva in Venice for one night before heading to Florence. The location is the best part about this Hotel. We literally walked 3 minutes to St. Marks Square. The husband and wife owners were incredibly friendly and our room was quiet, had its own bathroom and a window to the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reaction”
Reviews.Author: Elizwannatravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Riva on day 15 of our trip. Our legs and feet were weary from all the walking so we were looking for easy-access to our room as well as quiet. THIS IS NOT THE PLACE for either! The hotel is a convulated, storied, confusing layout of rooms, some over the scenic canal or over the walkways above a lively bar/restaurant. Because there were three of us, our room was a triple, right above the bar on a Saturday night. All night there were revelers leaning against the walls below loudly talking, singing and having a very happy time. Unfortunately we were so tired! We had had difficulty hauling our luggage up and over so many gyrations of stairs but the owner took pity and helped out. Such nice people. In the morning, the water taxis began their arrivals along with many other water-going vessels such as the garbage boat, the delivery trucks and so on. Motors on boats in confined areas on the water such as a Venice canal reverberated so loudly and constantly that it was grossly irritating. Yes, Hotel Riva is charming and yes, Hotel Riva is in a great place. Many wonderful things about it. But I would suggest another charming hotel which is easier to negotiate away from bars underneath windows, rooms bigger than postage stamps, and an easier way to reach one's room!

Reviews.Title: “So quaint, great location!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGal
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice and Hotel Riva is quintessentially Venice. You arrive by boat to San Marco Square; it takes your breath away. You walk past the Duomo and take a left--follow the street that goes between the bank and Angelo's restaurant, cross the bridge and the hotel is in front of you after you pass a gondola dock. You have to carry your bags up stairs, but get use to it; there are stairs through out Venice. I wish I'd arrived by water taxi; you would pull up right next to the hotel! We had a canal view room and it was worth the slightly higher price. I could have sat in that window day and night and watched the variety of boats navigate the turn. Room was cute, spotless and roomy enough. Location makes it easy to drop in and change or freshen up between sights, avoiding scary bathrooms. There isn't really a breakfast (a roll with jelly), but you get a great cappuccino. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: MARYChina
Reviews.Content: Honestly I have traveled the world and on this trip had 6 weeks in Europe and the RIVA hotel was the greatest value for money I have ever encountered. i can't believe someone said the location is "pretty good" . I counted my steps, 100 to San Marco ... so I was out before the crowds and had the option to head out again at night without it being an excursion... and 10 mins to Rialto ! Someone in the review said it was 10 mins from St. Mark's traghetto, it took me 3 mins with a bag. The hotel is set on the intersection of 3 canals, if you fell out the window of the dining area and reception you'd fall in to a canal or gondola. Ask for a room with a view - even if it has a shared bathroom - the view is to die for. I couldn't stop looking out the window as the colours and activity changed on the water through the day and night. My room was spotless. The staff were so friendly, an example was when I had to leave early on the last day a coffee and some breakfast was in my hand withtout asking and unexpectedly as it was before the designated breakfast time. This is not a 5 star hotel but it's real Venice, the staff had enough English to help me and offer suggestions, but not enough to make me feel I was 'just anywhere. 6 weeks and this place was one of the highlights of my trip due to the location, staff and most of all value for money !

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Riva and Venice”
Reviews.Author: Scottness
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Riva. The Hotel is on a canal that is a route for the gondolas. Very pretty. They pick up right at the hotel. They usually charge 100 for 25-30 minutes but we got it for 80 euro. We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. Bedroom was good sized and the bathroom was the nicest we had in Italy. Breakfast was simple but the cappuccinos were great. We really enjoyed Venice and our Hotel. It was just as easy to walk to Rialto Bridge as to Saint Mark's Square. Great Location. When you go to St. Marks be sure to pay for the treasury with the cool relics and the Museum which has a fantastic view from the balcony upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: dsandtiaah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my 17 year old daughter. We enjoyed our stay very much. I am very surprised to hear people say it is not clean and is like a hostel. These comments are far from our opinion. We had a beautiful room overlooking a quiet canal. Our room was large with classic venetian furnishings. marble floors and Murano glass chandeliers. Everything was very clean and the housekeepers were very visable working hard in the hallways. Breakfast was included and was served in a charming room with very helpful service. The owners were extremely warm and accomodating. The gentleman called our next hotel on his cell phone to let them know we would be late. The woman (Iris?) gave us a kiss on each cheek when we left. We took a ride on a gondola that was docked right outside the door of our hotel. We would definitely stay here on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great location, a bit dirty”
Reviews.Author: Tahoe09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the canal side views are a huge romantic plus. The place is bare bones, though, and the staff did not seem to speak much English, which could be a problem for some. Other than breakfast, no service is provided. Breakfast consists of a white roll, boxed juice, and coffee. Our room was charming and large, but not very clean. For instance, there were "head oil" stains on the fabric headboard and fingernail clippings in the rug. So, it suited our needs for a quick stay, but we would probably not return.

Reviews.Title: “Bring confirmation - Your confirmed room is not guaranteed and they tried to charge more”
Reviews.Author: teeseeann
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 months in advance, gave them my credit card number to reserve a room with CANAL view and without a bathroom (since they didn't have any room with a bathroom available.) They emailed to confirm (canal view, no bathroom) for 2 nights. 15 days before arrival, I re-confirmed. They emailed to acknowledge everything was OK. When I arrived, they gave me a room WITHOUT a canal view and wanted me to pay 20 euros extra because that room had a bathroom. After showing them their email confirmations, they backed off on making me pay extra. I told them I just wanted what I had reserved, but they said it wasn't available for both nights and that I could have it for the 2nd night only. So be aware that your reservation confirmation is still not a guarantee that you'll get the room you reserved. Also bring evidence of your confirmation so you can prove the room rate you had reserved.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing location and a great value”
Reviews.Author: ronnipete
Reviews.Content: My husband, 21 year old daughter and I reserved a triple room with water view at the Hotel Riva for two nights. As soon as we got off the boat, we went to the convenient TI and bought a detailed street map and used it to find our hotel. The entrance was just a few feet away from a beautiful canal, complete with gondola and gondolier. The steps in the hotel were marble, and we were given a corner room with views of two canals. The lady that helped us check in spoke English and was very nice and helpful. I couldn't stop looking out the windows - such a picturesque view we didn't want to leave! (But of course, we did.) When you book your room, be sure to pay extra for the water view. It was worth it. I realize that you don't go on vacation to spend time in your room, but this is Venice, and in this one instance is worth the extra 20 Euros. The location was also very convenient to everything, yet at the end of a quiet street. I can't say enough about our brief time there. I WILL go back! On a side note, the woman who checked us in suggested a restaurant around the corner for a quick bite. It was called Planet. We were skeptical - we came to Venice to eat at a place called Planet? The restaurant was very good and very reasonable. We had the best pizza on our entire trip, and our waiter was terrific. Breakfast was very simple - rolls and butter, and good coffee and juice. Quite sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “More of a hostel than hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: o2btraveling4
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from Venice - stayed at the Hotel Riva. The location is pretty good as it is near St. Mark's Square and we took a Gondola ride from right outside the door. The hotel is more like a nice hostel than a one star hotel. No air conditioner (fan only) so unless you like to be hot while you in your room I would not stay here in the summer. There is no elevator (which is common in Italy), so if you have heavy or big luggage...its no picnic. if you forget your shampoo or hairdryer you are out of luck because they don't have any to offer. It would be better to stay on the riverside of the hotel as the other side has drunken people walking down from your window throughout the night. The woman who is mainly working the desk seems like she doesn't want to be there and the man is very nice (I believe these are the owners) If you are just looking for a simple bed and shower - this is it. The breakfast was rolls with bread and jam, coffee and juice. I have lived in Italy for two years and have stayed in many types of hotels - I don't think that I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AllisonSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I would definetly recommend this hotel for it's location. It's close to St. Marks Square and The Rialto Bridge. The lobby has alot of charm, but I wouldn't say the same for the rooms. The rooms are very small and you have to take everything out of the bathroom before you shower so it doesn't get wet. Breakfast in the morning is nothing special, rolls with butter and jam, that's it. Most hotels give you different pastries and fruits to choose from, but not here. We didn't hate our stay, but we didn't love it either. I'm not sure that we would stay here again. Also, on our last morning there we woke up with a bunch of mosquito bites

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel on Gondola Route”
Reviews.Author: PakiCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Riva based on other reviews, recommendation by Rick Steves, price, and location near St. Mark's Square. It is about a 10 minute walk from the St. Mark's traghetto stop. But the location is ideal - near St. Mark's, near shopping/restaurants, on a gondola route, about 10 minutes walk to Rialto Bridge. The hotel is charming and staff friendly. We stayed three nights and had a view room with a private bath. The bed was comfortable, room adequately sized & clean with two large windows onto the canal, but a very small bathroom. The breakfast room is equally charming and inviting, but they only had the traditional hard rolls w/preserves and coffee/juice/milk...I needed more to start my day. We loved the view room even though it rained the first two mornings. It was a treat to have the gondoliers passing by and occasionally singing along the way. The only complaint was the "barge-type" boats coming through in the morning (but not too early) whether for construction, garbage, etc. as they can be quite loud. I would definitely recommend Hotel Riva to anyone and would consider booking with them again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaB27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riva recommended by friends who had previously stayed there. It has superb location. Room is simple but clean. No frigobar / No TV in room. Breakfast is simple too, but enough to keep you up and around until lunch. Staff was helpful. We will surely stay there when we return to Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay at Hotel Riva”
Reviews.Author: CardinalTravelers
Reviews.Content: We learned about Hotel Riva in a Rick Steves travel book about Venice, an we were very pleased with it during our two-night stay in May. The hotel is in a great location, just a couple of minutes' walk from St. Mark's, and we had no difficulty finding it. The location was ideal for us, near many of the places we wanted to see and an easy walk to the vaporetto stop near the Piazza San Marco. Also, it's near a number of places to eat. The hosts were friendly and accommodating. They spoke sufficient English to communicate well with us and went out of their way to be helpful, providing a hair dryer and various bits of information when asked. We had booked the room on the hotel website and communicated with the hosts a couple of times by phone and e-mail before we left the States. They were as good as their word, charging us exactly what they'd indicated to us in their e-mails. The price was very reasonable for Venice. We found our room clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was also very nice. We especially liked the fact that the room was quiet (our room was not on a canal), and the shutters made it dark enough for us to get a good night's sleep. The breakfast was not elaborate but tasted good---rolls, butter, and jelly served with coffee, hot tea, or hot chocolate. It was filling enough, and the dining room was clean and pleasant. Our favorite feature of Hotel Riva (besides the location) was the fact that it was an excellent value for the price. It was just the kind of small, basic hotel we like to stay in while in Europe. If you're looking for luxury, this is not the place for you. There are no in-room phones, televisions, or frills. However, if you're looking for a small, clean, friendly hotel with a personal atmosphere and a good price, Hotel Riva is a fine choice. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but could cost you more than your confirmation indicates”
Reviews.Author: csshwtravelers
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel Riva in Venice, Italy directly using email and then confirmed directly via telephone call two months before our arrival. However, when my family arrived they had no record of my confirmation. Apparently, the person I spoke to on the telephone didn't complete the confirmation to hold the room. We had booked a triple with air conditioning but we were offered rooms without air conditioning (same price as with air conditioning), or we were offered a triple with air conditioning for 40 euros more per night. This sounded like bait and switch to me but we were desperate and went along with the more expensive air conditioned room since one of our party was ill. Feeling as if I had been taken advantage of, I returned twice to the front desk to respectfully ask for a cheaper alternative with air conditioning as we booked (it was VERY hot in Venice that weekend) but were only given the option of a very small, cramped, hot and stuffy room over many staircases and through many corridors for the same price yet without air conditioning. They could have at least discounted the room without the air conditioning but they were going to charge the same amount as our original confirmed reservation (170 euros) which would have included air conditioning. The hotel was suitable, but the customer service was lacking. I don't think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: WCD4983
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, those people that are complaining about the size of their room and quality of breakfast of this hotel didn't properly do their research. Hotel Riva doesn't advertise itself as a 5 star hotel, but rather a 1 star in a great location. That is exactly what we got. I really have no complaints to make about our stay there. It was clean, it was easy to get to, and it gave us a perfect homebase to see Venice which is really what we were there for! My husband and I had very few requirements when looking for hotels. We wanted a private bathroom, a clean bed big enough for both of us (not two twins), and some sort of included breakfast. Most importantly, we wanted a good rate. We paid 120 Euros a night and felt it was a very fair rate for the location. No, the owners weren't falling over themselves with hospitality, but they were certainly cordial and efficient and never rude. Yes, the walls were thin, but my husband and I found this to be a pretty common problem throughout Italy so I wouldn't hold it against this particular hotel, and it really isn't a problem unless you get one rude guest (which we unfortunately did) who comes home at 3 cussing and stumbling! We literally saw the room when we woke up and fell asleep so maybe our perspective is skewed, but we would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The Riva is a treasure”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyUSA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Riva is a treasure. Access to it was easy as we parked our car at the Tronchetto and took the Vaporetto to St. Mark's square. The directions they supplied were great as it was just a short walk behind St. Mark's to the Riva. I love beautiful old buildings and you can just feel a sense of history in the Riva. My friend and I loved our room and the fact that we could look out the window and see the canal and the busy street below. (Yet it was very quiet for sleeping.) I especially enjoyed sitting eating in the breakfast room and watching the gondoliers pass by. I want to commend the young lady who greeted us on our arrival. She was most welcoming and helpful to us in our stay there. We have already recommended the Riva to some other travelers we met on our trip through Italy and hope to be able to return with our husbands one day to share Venice and this place with them The only negatives of our 3 day stay was the breakfast offered each day was extremely hard rolls. As Americans, we were not used to this. Would have loved a pastry, croissant or even some yogurt or cereal. I would also not recomment the restaurant they sent us to the first night (Planet). We had asked for something close by as it was rainy and we had had a long day. You can do much better than this place. However, the Riva itself was a little gem as far as we were concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: abseen
Reviews.Content: We ended our trip to Italy in Venice and picked the Hotel Riva because of Rick Steeves guidebook. We read the reviews on TripAdvisor and although there were some negative ones, the positive out weighed them. We booked a canal view room for two nights. We were extremely disappointed in this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone. The floors were very dirty, the room itself was very dark, lightbulbs in the nightlamp did not work, the shutter on one window was ready to fall in the canal. The walls were so thin that we could hear every word the people in the next rooms were saying and also every time they went to the bathroom. The breakfast was a hard roll and coffee - totally unlike the fabulous breakfasts we had had in our hotels in Rome and Florence. We found the hotel staff/owners to be very remote and not really interested in us as customers until we paid the bill. That was the only time we saw a smile from them. The location of the hotel was the only nice part of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Riva was perfect for our needs!!”
Reviews.Author: SendMeSomewhere
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riva enjoys an excellent location in between St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. It is right on a canal junction on the gondola route. We paid 130 euros per night for a canal view room (on the corner, so we could see both directions) and were thrilled with the experience. We found the owners to be very helpful and kind, contrary to what other reviewers have written. One drawback was that our room was on the 4th floor (no lift), and my 58-year old mother had some trouble going up and down the stairs. However, if you're like us, you won't be hanging out in your room much anyway while in Venice, and we were OK with the daily climb and descent. I would also take some mosquito repellent if you stay anywhere near the canals, as we did have a few bites in the morning after having left our windows open. The room was much bigger than we expected, and the shower was strong and hot. There was no phone or TV. Make sure you have a good map (Rick Steves' map was a little confusing to us, so we had to pick up a more detailed map), as the hotel is down a few side streets. Also, be sure to stray from the well-beated tourist path that goes between Rialto and St. Mark's so that you get a better feeling for the city without all the tourists pushing and shoving to get from one sight to the next. Overall, we were very pleased with Hotel Riva and would recommend it to anyone interested in a great location, good-sized room, for a moderate price!!
